title: 73 Sri Lankan pilgrims preparing to leave Nepal
byline: A group of 73 Sri Lankan pilgrims currently stationed at the India–Nepal border is preparing to leave Nepal after completing their visit to the sacred city of Lumbini, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Apple Event Highlights: iPhone 17, iPhone Air and More — A Guide for Sri Lankans
byline: Apple has just unveiled a major lineup of new products at its annual event in Cupertino, California, and the spotlight is firmly on the iPhone 17 series and the all-new iPhone Air. For Sri Lankan consumers, tech enthusiasts, and Apple loyalists, here’s everything you need to know about the updates, features, and prices — and how they could impact you.

title: Supreme Court to decide if Trump’s global tariffs are legal
byline: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear arguments on whether the Trump administration’s sweeping global tariffs are legal.

title: India grants Rs. 600 mn for new A&E unit in Mannar Hospital
byline: India has extended a grant of Rs. 600 million for the construction of a new Accident and Emergency (A&E) unit at the District General Hospital in Mannar.

title: No provisions to take up NCM against a Deputy Minister: Speaker
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne announced today that the no confidence motion against Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekera cannot be taken up for debate as there is no provision to bring such a motion as he does not bear responsibility to Parliament as in the case of a Cabinet Minister.

title: AKD expected to participate in President ’s entitlement  Repeal Bill debate today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is expected to participate in the debate on the President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill which is to be taken up today, Parliament sources said.

title: Spend smarter, WB cautions Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka must focus on smarter spending and fairer revenue collection to sustain its economic gains, the World Bank cautioned in a report published yesterday, as the country seeks to consolidate one of the sharpest fiscal adjustments in its history.

title: Hasaranga most wanted even half fit
byline: Sri Lanka will be banking heavily on talismanic leg-spinner Wanindu Hasaranga when they open their Asia Cup T20 campaign against Bangladesh in Abu Dhabi on Saturday in what promises to be a defining early clash of the tournament.

title: Global promotion gaps put SL’s 2030 tourism targets at risk
byline: Sri Lanka’s ambitious plan to attract five million tourists and generate US$ 10 billion in annual revenue by 2030 is under threat as bureaucratic delays stall a critical global promotional campaign, industry leaders said.

title: Amadyapa Maha Sabha to launch drug counseling program
byline: The Amadyapa Maha Sabha, under the leadership of its Chairman, Most Venerable Dr. Ittapane Dhammalankara Thera, has commenced specialized programs on Buddhist Psychology, Drug Prevention, and Counseling at its newly established headquarters in Thalapatpitiya, Sri Jayewardenepura.

title: List of ex-MPs who paid for Viyathpura homes revealed
byline: The list of former Members of Parliament (MPs) who had placed their initial deposits to purchase houses from the Viyathpura Housing Complex have been revealed.

title: Nishantha Ulugetenne further remanded
byline: Former Navy Commander Admiral (Rtd) Nishantha Ulugetenne was today ordered to be further remanded until September 24 by the Polgahawela Magistrate’s Court.

title: Over 1,500 prisoners escape from Nepal jail during unrest
byline: At least 1,500 inmates have fled from Nakhu prison in Lalitpur, Nepal, amid nationwide unrest.

title: Indictments against Keheliya, family to be taken up again
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Lanka Jayaratne today ordered that the case filed against former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his wife, three daughters and son-in-law over allegations of unlawfully acquiring assets, be taken up again on September 15.

title: Major judicial reshuffle: Over 100 officials transferred
byline: A total of 106 judicial officials have been transferred effective from September 15, 2025, the Judicial Service Commission said.

title: Macron names ally Sébastien Lecornu as new French PM
byline: President Emmanuel Macron has named close ally Sébastien Lecornu as the new French prime minister, 24 hours after a vote of confidence ousted François Bayrou as head of government.

title: Colombo central bus terminal to close for 10 months for renovations
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) has announced that its Central Bus Terminal in Colombo will be closed for renovations for a period of 10 months, starting tomorrow (11).

title: SriLankan Airlines suspends flights to Nepal
byline: SriLankan Airlines announced today that its flights to Nepal have been temporarily suspended following the closure of Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu.

title: British citizen honoured for helping Ella bus accident victims
byline: Amy Victoria, a British citizen, was honoured by the Tourism Ministry for her role in assisting those injured in the recent bus accident in Ella on Tuesday.

title: Bus owner arrested over Ella tragedy
byline: The owner of the bus involved in the accident at Ella, which claimed the lives of 15 people, has been arrested by the Ella Police.

title: Supreme Court to decide if Trump’s global tariffs are legal
byline: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear arguments on whether the Trump administration’s sweeping global tariffs are legal.

title: Wife of ex-Nepali prime minister burnt alive
byline: The wife of former prime minister of Nepal Jhala Nath Khanal has died after she was burned alive when her home was set on fire amid violent anti-government protests in the country, regional media reported.

title: Archchuna only Opposition MP to support President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill
byline: Opposition MP Ramanathan Archchuna became the only MP to vote in favour of the President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill, which seeks to cut down privileges of former Presidents.

title: Chamara Sampath only MP to vote against President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill
byline: Opposition MP Chamara Sampath Dissanayake became the sole Opposition MP to vote against the President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill.

title: Third reading of President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill approved without a vote
byline: The third reading of the President’s Entitlement Repeal Bill was approved by Parliament without a vote today.

title: Ella bus accident: Owner released on bail
byline: The owner of the bus involved in the accident at Ella, which claimed the lives of 15 people,  has been granted bail by the Bandarawela Magistrate’s Court.

title: Former Moratuwa mayor remanded
byline: Former Mayor of the Moratuwa Municipal Council, Saman Lal Fernando, who was arrested today by the Bribery Commission (CIABOC) was remanded till September 23 by Colombo Cheif Magistrate Asanga S Bodaragama.

title: Mahinda Rajapaksa ready to return to Medamulana: D.V Chanaka
byline: MP D.V. Chanaka said that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is ready to return to his residence in Medamulana.

title: Sri Lanka squad for Women’s World Cup released
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Panel has selected a 15-member squad to participate in the ICC Women’s World Cup 2025.

title: Sri Lanka expresses concern over air strikes in Qatar
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed deep concern over the recent air strikes reported in Qatar, warning that they could further escalate regional volatility and undermine security.

title: Rs. 500 million allocated for school laboratory grants in 2025
byline: The Education Ministry has allocated Rs. 500 million as a school-based grant under the Secondary Education Sector Improvement Program (SESIP) for 2025, to purchase equipment and chemicals for Category 1AB and 1C school laboratories across the country.

title: Namal takes Sunil Watagala to task over defamatory remarks, sends letter of demand
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser MP Namal Rajapaksa is to take legal action against Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala over his remark saying ’Namal behind drug menace’.

title: Foreign Ministry urges Sri Lankans in Nepal to remain vigilant
byline: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism has advised all Sri Lankan nationals currently in Nepal to remain vigilant and strictly follow the guidance of local authorities in light of the prevailing situation.

title: Former Moratuwa Mayor arrested
byline: Former Mayor of the Moratuwa Municipal Council, Samanlal Fernando, has been arrested by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Unrest in Nepal: Ranil issues statement
byline: Opportunities created by American-owned social media companies to overthrow governments around the world cannot be underestimated, former President Ranil Wickremesinghe said today.

title: Police foil planned nightclub attack in Kollupitiya, seize weapons
byline: In the wake of escalating gun violence in several areas, police averted a major attack suspected to have been orchestrated by an organized criminal gang targeting an individual reportedly working at nightclubs in Kollupitiya.

title: Namal warns of rising extremism behind South Asian protests
byline: Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa has expressed concern over the unfolding situation in Nepal, drawing parallels with protests that have erupted across South Asia in recent years.

title: Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill has no bearing on former Presidents’ security: Minister
byline: The Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill has no bearing on the security of former Presidents after its enactment, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said today.

title: Over 200,000 vehicles imported since January
byline: A total of 200,026 vehicles have been imported into the country between January 1 and September 2025, of which 154,537 have already been released by the Department of Customs, the Committee on Finance revealed.

title: Four arrested over fake bank website scam, Rs. 50 million stolen
byline: Four suspects were ordered to be remanded till September 25 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama, over allegations of creating a fake website resembling that of a private bank in Sri Lanka and fraudulently obtaining Rs. 50 million belonging to the bank.

title: SC introduces card payment transactions for court payments
byline: The introduction of card transaction facilities to the court system, as a preliminary step toward automating public payments, took place today at the Supreme Court premises under the patronage of Chief Justice Preethi Padman Surasena.

title: Sacked ref accused of making indecent image of child
byline: Former Premier League referee David Coote has been charged with making an indecent image of a child.

title: Opposition contemplating no-confidence motion against Speaker
byline: All Opposition parties representing Parliament are to initiate a dialogue to decide on bringing in a no-confidence motion against Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne whom they accuse of failing to come up with a proper ruling on the no faith motion against Deputy Defence Minister Aruna Jayasekera.

title: UPDATE: Fire reported in Sapugaskanda oil refinery
byline: A fire has erupted at Tank 2 (slug tank) of the Sapugaskanda oil refinery this evening, a senior official from the refinery confirmed.

title: SLBFE warns against unauthorized agents for overseas jobs
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has issued a warning to job seekers to avoid dealing with unauthorized agents or middlemen.

title: Online applications open for 1,500 renovation jobs in Israel
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has announced that online applications are now open for 1,500 vacancies in Israel’s general renovation sector.

title: Writ petition filed to halt illegal activities in Wilpattu National Park
byline: The Environmental Foundation (Guarantee) Limited (EFL) filed a writ application before the Court of Appeal seeking urgent intervention to halt alleged illegal activities within the Wilpattu National Park, particularly in and around the Pallekandal Church in Block V of the park.

title: Nepal Protests: Kathmandu airport reopens
byline: After a 24-hour closure, Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport has reopened for all civilian flights, according to a statement from the Nepal Civil Aviation Authority on Wednesday.

title: CSE rebounds strongly amid elevated turnover
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) witnessed an eventful session today, marked by sharp intraday swings and robust investor activity.

title: Protective embankment built at site of fatal Ella-Wellawaya accident
byline: A protective embankment was constructed today (10) at the 15th milepost on the Ella-Wellawaya main road, where 15 persons were killed and 18 others injured in a tragic bus accident last week, Uva Province Governor’s Counsel, Attorney-at-Law Kapila Jayasekara said.

title: All the squads for ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025
byline: Hosts India were the first team to announce their 15-member squad for the Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025.

title: House hunting begins for Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: Supporters of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa have begun searching for a new residence in Colombo for him, following the enactment of a new law that stripped former Presidents of their official benefits, a source close to him said.

title: Speaker endorses Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill
byline: Speaker Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne endorsed the certification on the Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Bill this afternoon, the Parliament Communication Department said.

title: Circular issued on student admissions from grade 2 to 11
byline: The Education Ministry has issued a new circular regarding the admission of students from Grade 2 to Grade 11, excluding Grades 5 and 6.

title: Makandure Madush’s wife urges IGP to probe his death
byline: The wife of late underworld figure Makandure Madush, Gayani Muthumala, has requested the Inspector General of Police (IGP) to investigate into the death of her husband, alleging that there is suspicion over his death while in Police custody.

title: Body of one-year-old found on Bambalapitiya beach
byline: The body of a one-year-old boy was discovered washed ashore near the Bambalapitiya railway station beach this morning, police said.
